intro: Othocallis morrisii var. veneris, commonly known as the Morris' sedge variant Venus, is a lesser-known plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit, typically found in moist, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, clustered spikelets that are often green or brown in color, depending on the season. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
